oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Carnegie Hall invitation card
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Performing Identity
Musicians
African American singers
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: United States -- New York (State) -- New York
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cream colored engraved card with text: Thursday January 26th 8:30 o'clock in Carnegie Hall The Fisk University Choir of Sixty Voices will give its first public concert in New York City.

The music department of Fisk University trained both large and small choral groups in addition to the Jubilee Singers. Groups regularly traveled to perform and the Fisk University Choir was featured over the Columbia Broadcasting network in the 1940s.
